Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); part of lotus flower in faded added white outline with traces of added red centres above two faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion’s head to right circumscribed by a sloppily painted band.
Curator's comments: The image might represent a shield device. Cook and Woodhead suggest that the subject matter on the vase was Heracles.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no, 876, pl. 119)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166 note 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1111) (phase 2)
